meanings.definition: A wheeled cart used for transporting goods in a supermarket.
meanings.sent1: I pushed the trollies filled with groceries around the store.
meanings.sent2: The trollies in the supermarket were all neatly lined up.
meanings.sent3: The trollies raced each other down the aisles when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The trollies moved like silent shadows through the store.
meanings.sent5: The bright red trollies stood out against the white floor.

meanings.definition: The act of moving a wheeled cart in a supermarket.
meanings.sent1: Her job involved a lot of trollies every day.
meanings.sent2: The sound of trollies rolling echoed in the supermarket.
meanings.sent3: The trollies seemed to have a mind of their own, dodging obstacles.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by as she focused on the trollies' smooth movements.
meanings.sent5: The rhythm of the trollies' wheels created a calming effect.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'trolley'.
meanings.sent1: The trollies were all in use during the busy shopping hours.
meanings.sent2: She remembered to grab two trollies for their big grocery trip.
meanings.sent3: The trollies clattered together as they were pushed around.
meanings.sent4: The trollies stood out with their bright colors in the store.
meanings.sent5: The trollies' wheels squeaked as they turned corners.
